column5: Hello all, i need some suggestions from who ever is willing, no hot spots. i have half day saturday to fish. live in aurora, and was wanting to go somewhere not to far, to put the boat in the water and fish till dark????  any help would be much appreciated  thanks, Peps
Hi Peps,  Simple you are in Aurora  - Simcoe Cooks Bay.  FLEX
From Aurora your a stones throw from Cook's Bay.  There you can get into perch, SM and LM Bass, and pike.  Good Luck and report back where ever you go.
thanks guys,  i was thinking Cooks Bay, but i also had Scugog on my mind but I don't know where to launch in Scugog....any thoughts?  Peps

Peps, I still stand by my first post, go to COOKS BAY, you have it all and to boot it is in your back yard.  By any chance any space on board, I know Cooks Bay quite well if you are interested please let me know.  Thanks,  FLEX

Scugog is a tough lake to fish if you don't know where to go...especially this time of year when lots of it is just thick thick weeds.  That's why I don't fish it after July....unless someone out there wants to give up some secret spots....LOL.  Kidding...just kidding....(about the locations...not the weeds)
I guess sucog is out....thanks Cliff. Flex if there is room i will let you know.  supposed to be 3 of us and that pretty much max out my boat, sorry dude maybe next time  peps
Check out the rivers the salmon are alreday up some of the rivers.

I gave up river fishing some time ago, after a not so pleasant encounter with a couple of treble hooking snaggers   .  It's to bad cause I really enjoyed it, and after that day I promised myself I would not go river fishing again.  So back to where I'm going might hit Sparrow Lake.  Peps
